derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: perhaps related to French regimber (earlier regiber) 'to buck, rear'; 比较 jibe

entry.tran: 艏三角帆；主帆前的小帆
entry.def: The jib is the small triangular sail that is sometimes used at the front of a sailing boat.
If you jib at something, you are unwilling to do it or to accept it.

example.ex: ...those who jib at the idea of selling their land.
example.tran: 那些拒绝出让土地的人

means.word_mean: 1. any triangular fore-and-aft sail (set forward of the foremast)
2. shift from one side of the ship to the other;
